required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Utility of Esophageal Cooling Therapy for the Prevention of Thermal Injury During Atrial Fibrillation Ablation (eCoolAF)

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determine if esophageal cooling using the Attune Medical Esophageal Heat Transfer Device (EnsoETM) limits the number or seriousness of injury to the esophagus during atrial fibrillation ablation procedures. The EnsoETM is an FDA cleared device used for temperature management, but is not routinely used during atrial fibrillation ablation procedures.

detailed_description.textblock: The EnsoETM is a non-sterile multi-lumen silicone tube placed in the esophagus for the purpose of cooling or warming a patient while simultaneously allowing gastric decompression and drainage. Modulation and control of the patient's temperature is achieved by connecting the EnsoETM to an external heat exchanger. Two lumens connect to the external heat exchanger, while a third central lumen provides stomach access for connection to a fluid collection device with low intermittent suction for gastric decompression. The EnsoETM is made of standard medical-grade silicone. It is a single-use, disposable, non-implantable device with an intended duration of use of 72 hours or less. Distilled water circulates within the EnsoETM just like a water blanket.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Randomized, blinded single center pilot study

primary_outcome.measure: Esophageal thermal injury between groups measured by EGD
primary_outcome.description: Any injury, occurrence rate measured by EGD
The severity and size of injury measured by EGD

secondary_outcome.description: PV reconnection present or no as recorded in Carto
Location of PV reconnection present or no as recorded in Carto
Clinically documented Atrial Fibrillation via review of multiple data sources in clinical record

arm_group.description: Patients randomized to Group A receive the EnsoETM (Attune Medical Esophageal Heat Transfer Device).
Patients randomized to Group B receive standard of care treatment (standard temperature probe monitoring).

intervention.description: The EnsoETM is a non-sterile multi-lumen silicone tube placed in the esophagus for the purpose of cooling or warming a patient while simultaneously allowing gastric decompression and drainage.
intervention.other_name: Attune Medical Esophageal Heat Transfer Device

intervention.description: Standard of care involves standard temperature probe monitoring.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Patients above the age of 18 years old.
2. Patients with the diagnosis of atrial fibrillation undergoing clinically indicated de-novo AF ablation procedure.
3. Patients must be able to understand and critically review the informed consent form.
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Patients whom are unable to provide informed consent.
2. Patients with contraindication to EGD.
3. History of prior AF ablation procedures.
4. Significant co-morbidities that preclude standard ablation procedure.
5. Patient is ineligible for EnsoETM placement due to:
- Known esophageal deformity or evidence of esophageal trauma (for example history of esophagectomy, previous swallowing disorders, achalasia).
- Known ingestion of acidic or caustic poisons within the prior 24 hours.
- Patients with <40 kg of body mass.
